Attention to consequences is necessary if we wish to leadthe best possible life or achieve the best possible politicalorder. […]" S. 8: "But ultimate ideals do more than call attention toconsequences. A social event has an enormous numberof consequences, and the Baconian task of enumeratingand cataloguing them is as laborious as it is futile. ! > Men needs guides which direct attention not to conse-quences in general, but to this or that class of events.In other words, we need principles of some use inordering social events, < !  so that policies designed toresolve a particular problem may be formulated inan intelligent and economical fashion.
